Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RiminiGrace Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been a faithful client since 1999. The hotel has a perfect location to visit London. The rooms are very small, according to the brit standards. They are quite clean. The area is quite and there all lots pf restaurants and bars where you can eat.

Reviews.Title: “London is definitely outpriced”
Reviews.Author: bambam45160
Reviews.Content: the typical hotel that could cost 40 € in any other city in Europe but as you're in London and during Christmast shopping time, it costs 175 £/night We came last week to London to visit one client, the guy wanted to please us and told us he'll book the hotel and paid 375 £ for 2 rooms but honestly i could have spend the money to drink in a club and then sleep on the sofa..... the room was less than 10 square meters, no heat and as it was only 8° outside (probably too much for the staff) the window was open ! the bathroom/toilets is so small that you could play the famous "toilets & shave" game when everyone is coming back at night you can easilly know what the think and say as the sound is like if they were in your room definitely not worth the money. And you know what is the worst ?? in the morning of the day after we had, with the same client, a breakfast at Rennaissance Hotel in St Pancrass (which is now my favorite hotel in London) before going to Paris so it was like coming from Hell to Heaven, but it was only for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “modest”
Reviews.Author: suzi s
Reviews.Content: Not recomended. I have the impression that floors are not cleaned. Lift is not safe. Good position.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Cattraveller4
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you can avoid it. The service is horrible. When we arrived they had lost our reservation and accused us of not confirming, even though we had a printed confirmation and the rooms had been pre-paid. Eventually we got our rooms although my father had to pack up the next morning and leave his luggage in storage all day because they weren't sure what room they would have for him for the second night. The TV in my room didn't work and when I went to reception the woman there said it was probably the batteries in the remote and there was nothing she could do about it. She would leave a note for it to be fixed the next day. The next night it still wasn't fixed and this same reception person again said there was nothing she could do about it. When I asked if she could give me a discount she said no, only the manager could do that and the manager was off for the weekend. What kind of hotel has no manager on the weekend?? Add to this very little hot water, broken sink stopper, filthy carpets and surly breakfast staff (except Melina, she is nice) and a smell of sewage in the main floor hall and you have a very unpleasant stay. London is busy and expensive but you can do much better than the Reem hotel. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “stayed in the box”
Reviews.Author: tetleydog
Reviews.Content: first impressions not to bad but then opened the door to our room or should i say box, it was down in the basement and smelt of stale cigerette smoke. The bed was clean but the room was in need of up dating,the sink plug in the bathroom was broken, breakfast was ok nothing special and only sit were you are told or Anna will shout at you i had to go and ask for milk for the tea and was given a rather frosty look from her as she was eating her toast in full view of other guests comming into breakfast.Also the fire exit door was locked as my husband heard it being unlocked the next morning so the staff could go out to smoke and then let the smoke drift into our room.sorry reems we wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Dorka_Gabor
Reviews.Content: It costs a fortune but the location of the hotel is excellent. Our room was also a tiny one (as many people wrote before me) but it was not a huge problem for us because we were in the city all day. But the room wasn't very clean and sometimes they forgot to empty the bin. The biggest problem for us was the noise. When we tried to sleep after a long day we heard almost everything because of the thin walls. The continental breakfast was great and I liked their coffee very much. We didn't have any problem with the service and the reception. All things considered, this hotel is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorwichHomer
Reviews.Content: As others say, in a good area for restaurants, tube etc. We were given a larger room than i expected, especially as i had made a mistake when booking, and a double bed was in the 1st room. The reception guy did move us into a twin room with no fuss, and we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lucydog96
Reviews.Content: The 1st room we were offered was on the 4th floor and TINY. Luckily the bathroom light didn't work so we got moved to the 3rd floor, which was much better. If we'd stayed on the 4th floor this review would have been very different. As it was, the room was adequate, the breakfast was good (though the waiting staff origianally tried to tell us that full english wasn't included in the price) the location was convenient. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “3rd world reaches London”
Reviews.Author: creswelllad Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: If you pay lower prices in central London, you know it's going to be small but my room was so small you couldn't even open the bathroom door properly. My main problem with the Reem was the overall standard of plumbing and cleanliness. When someone 2 floors above used the loo - I knew about it as the sound of (****) slid down the pipes in my room as it made it's way to the sewers below. All of the grout and sealant was tainted with mould and other green/black stuff and there were the stains of the previous occupant's toothpaste all over the bathroom tiles. The restaurant staff were pleasant but the reception staff could do with a few lessons in customer care. I had to leave my bag in the hotel one day and was told it would go in the basement luggage room, but the two people in the reception area would not move it for me as the 'don't employ a porter' so I followed their directions and took it myself only to find a locked door. When I returned to the reception (carrying my bag up and down the stairs), I was given the code to unlock the door - which they knew I would need so could have done before I made my first trip to the basement. I will not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: surreytravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10-15 mins stroll from Queensway tube station, in a square that is partly in need of a bit of TLC to lick all the buildings into shape. That said, the Reem Hotel itself stands out by looking cared-for and painted and seems to me to offer the best balance between price and quality. The room was clean, but tiny - moving round the bed was impossible without climbing over it! However the view of the little square was pretty and everything in the room was fine - the en-suite bathroom was probably slightly larger than the bedroom. The staff were friendly, and the breakfast room that they have created downstairs is surprisingly airy and pleasant, with very helpful staff offering a more "European" breakfast service that one normally finds in the UK. If you regard the hotel as a place to stay for not too much money while enjoying London, you will not be disappointed, although I don't think I'd want to stay there more than a couple of nights simply because of the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, except the lift is broken”
Reviews.Author: huckColorado
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the location is very pleasant. The stairway is steep and narrow-very difficult for seniors to carry up the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: maxisweden
Reviews.Content: I have stayed three times at this hotel in less than a year, and I will return next time I am in London. The pros: * Clean rooms, especially the bathroom. VERY important for me - I'm rather picky when it comes to cleanliness. * Friendly and helpful staff * Excellent location in a quiet area and yet there are many restaurants (with a wide variety of cuisine) within only a few minutes walk. The Whitleys shopping centre is close too. Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park is also close. Two tube stations within easy reach - Bayswater (with two lines: District and Circle) and Queensway (the Central line). This means that you have pretty much everything in London within easy reach. Also, the area itself feels safe and this is also something that I value as a female traveller who sometimes does things on my own even if I'm travelling with others. * Cheap rooms - great if you want to spend your money on other things than lodging. The rooms are small but I rather spend my money on other things when in London so for this price, the size of the rooms doesn't bother me. Since the hotel is clean and cheap, I'm content. From what I've read about other hotels in the same price range here on Tripadvisor, I have to say that this is a gem. If you want a luxury hotel, find something else (and be prepared to pay more than you do for this one).

Reviews.Title: “thats ok for me”
Reviews.Author: luciend
Reviews.Content: if you need a hotel for bed and breakfast its ok. its a small hotel with small rooms. deswk staff polite but the girls that stays in the kitchen and help the breakfast are very un polite. they told me about the full breakfast until 10.00 am. but when i came 9.45 they told me they couldnt fry the bacon( its not a big problem, but they should have told me about). 7 min walking until bayswater tube station. and with restaurants, comerce, money exchange, pharmacy and etc. safe area. good sleep quality and good beds i wouldnt recomend in summer. i didint see ar condicioner, just fan in the list that i received it was the best hotel. for me it was ok. my wife didnt like it like me. but its not a bad hotel ITS A HOTEL FOR BED AND BREAKFAST

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Tiltom
Reviews.Content: We searched for a long while to find a great hotel in a great area for a one night stay in London and this is what we found! The Reem is a clean hotel that needs a bit of renovating but for a one night stay is was perfect for what we needed. We arrived 45 minutes early which was not a problem for them and they let us into our room and we were able to drop our bags off and go and explore London. Our room was right next to the lift however, it was so quiet we couldn't hear anything, the only thing we would say was that the floor boards were a bit creaky and we could hear the people above us talking, but it wasn't much of a problem. The two staff members we met were friendly and helpful and we would definitely recommend staying here. The location is great, it's about a 5 minute walk to Bayswater underground and from there you are able to travel anywhere and everywhere, which we did. Also, there are lots of shops and places to eat in the evening, just a nice little place to go and explore. Overall a really lovely hotel and place to stay and a great weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephenbell0
Reviews.Content: I was initially excited about staying at this hotel, as it appeared to get good reviews from others on this website. I was placed in a sub-ground room at the very front of the hotel, about the size of a large shoebox. It's position below the entrance hallway meant that whenever anyone came into or left the hotel, I would hear their footsteps amplified into my room. Also, I was repeatedly awoken very early in the mornings by: â€¢ Loud talking right outside my door â€¢ Someone actually coming into my room and then not shutting the door â€¢ Slamming fire door right outside the room â€¢Â Noisy pipes when others in the hotel were using the bathrooms Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jhaynes55
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room with bathroom. The bathroom was just big enough for 1 person but was adequate and clean. The room itself was bigger than I had expected, had been advised of how small hotel rooms on a budget could be, we only wanted a place to get clean, change and sleep as we spent most of our days out and about. The location, 55 Princess Square Bayswater, was great, 1 & half blocks from start/end Kensington Park, buses and trains, and only a few minutes walk to Portobello road and plenty of pubs nearby for meals at decent prices.

Reviews.Title: “clean but rooms to hot and to small”
Reviews.Author: mikehome
Reviews.Content: myself my wife and relatives of ours from australia stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and 4 days in june/july we found the hotel clean and situated in a fantastic area to suit everyone we also found the staff was fantastically helpfull with any problems or advice. the only downside which we did not like was that the rooms are to small also the rooms was way to hot and last of all for the price that we payed we feel that breakfast should have being included and not classed as a paying extra.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nightgardener
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reem Hotel for one night earlier this month, and shared a three-bed room with two friends. The room was small, but had a very high, pretty ceiling and was clean and tidy. We only booked the room to have somewhere to sleep after a hen night and didn't actually spend any time there, so I didn't mind the small size. The room was very hot when we arrived and we couldn't open the window, but the fan cooled the room efficiently. The bathroom was clean and as you'd expect from a hotel of this standard. So, if you're looking for a no-frills, clean hotel near Notting Hill, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Building work in progress, stay away”
Reviews.Author: Dave-k-Morgan
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel to find a lot building / Maintenance work ongoing. I had not been made aware of this when booking my room. The front is covered in scoffolding. The room I was allocated was like a prison cell, bars at the window ( room 3) beware.. It was right under the main enterance way where the Floor covering had been removed making the room unacceptably noisy.. The receptioinist did not have another double room, I had specifically asked for / needed a double room. I was refused a refund. There was no offer to help me find an alternative hotel, I had to walk the streets late in the evening to find another hotel.. Having looked at other reviews on this website I notice that although this hotel has quite a high recomendation score a lot of the more recent reviews have been poor... My advise is to stay away while this hotel is in such a state.. have another look in 2011...

Reviews.Title: “Not very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Fluffybuff
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel is cheap but I didn't expect the rooms to be so small, that there would be nasty stains on carpets, and that I would have to move the bed to get into the bathroom. Toilet didn't flush either. On the plus side the staff were friendly and the location was good. Next time though I will spend more money.

Reviews.Title: “For the money - good value”
Reviews.Author: JabbaJake
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, at Â£35 a night, this is a very cheap hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that it was in a good area, that it was clean and tidy and that the staff were helpful. It might need a lick of paint and a bit of tlc but all that said, it was clean, tidy and very good value. The room was very small but then I only needed a bed for the night so unless you expect the Ritz for decor or want a romatic break, this hotel will do nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap anddirty”
Reviews.Author: Rene S
Reviews.Content: Although I booked a single room I was allocated to a double room on the groundfloor.The general appearance of that room was dull,dirty and cold.This made matters worse because it was snowing in London on that day and it was very very cold. There was an old dirty cover on the bed the same color as the long dirty curtain.The whole room was very dusty.The washbasin had not been cleaned and there were stubborn marks inside the washbasin.Totally disgusting!.The door of the room nextdoor to mine was open and it looked extremely untidy and very filthy with furniture piled on top of each other.This give off a bed smell which came in my room.PLEASE CLEAN YOUR HOTEL. On my return home I still itch although I have taken 2 hot showers.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireMonkey
Reviews.Content: We were told on arrival we had been upgraded to a triple room and this would be of no extra cost to us THANKS !!, The room was a disgrace dirty bed linen, stained carpets all over the hotel, very small room for 3 !! Water stain over carpet outside of bathroom that was faded and worn. No hot water knob on the shower BUT that was ok as the cold water was HOT . One member of the breakfast staff was rude unhelpful, wiped tables with a cloth picked up off the floor. The double bed was in fact a 3/4 bed and very very hard. The reception staff were friendly and polite but i wouldnt use this hotel ever again,alot of staff didnt speak good english andthe hotel was embaressing to what other countries provide for the same amount of monies. Everything else about our trip was excellent , just not the hotel hope the management listen to their customers/

Reviews.Title: “avoid the single room”
Reviews.Author: an7ed
Reviews.Content: Decided to book due to moderately good reviews on Tripadvisor but was terribly disappointed with the intial single room (more like a box in the subground level)...the washbasin drained poorly and so did the shower....the staff made an effort and changed the room to a family room after some persuation...but even this was very basic....bed was unevenly springy and uncomfortable...the shower in this room also drained poorly...the tiles on the floor were cracked...the carpets in the common areas looked dirty and dated...perhaps the only saving grace was a decent breakfast...wouldn't recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Tripper-York
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, it was dirty as soon as you went in the door the stair carpet was stained .Our room was so small we could strugeled to get past each other,one bed was pushed up to the wall with only four inches between the other bed.The wallpaper was torn and stuck down with cellotape.the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen this was in need of a full refurnish it was filthy. Going down to the breakfast room was like been in a different hotel it was bright and modern the staff were friendly the food was good with a choice of continental or for a small charge full english. I under space is at a premium in London but this was too small for our four night stay and no excuse for dirt. The location is great easy to get into the center of London, and Hyde Park,Queensway is close by and you can get any type of food you want it is a livley street good night life with a nice feel about it.

Reviews.Title: “Value-Priced Simplicity”
Reviews.Author: toddtravelslv
Reviews.Content: I had turn-by-turn walking directions from Bayswater tube station. There are so many Princes Streets that we got lost and couldn't find the hotel for 20 minutes! But we finally found it and were pleasantly surprised. The very friendly desk agent gave us the key to number 14. The room as the normal size of any other London hotel room. There was a small television with about 10 channels, a coffee maker with coffee supplies, and a large window that opened. The loo was sufficient, but not well-ventilated. Therefore, there were small bits of mold on the ceiling. This really didn't bother me as we were only there for one night. There is a computer for guest use in the lobby, but wireless Internet is charged. The tube is only a 7 minute walk, which is perfect for the holidayers. Near the tube station are Cinnabon, McDonalds, and several markets. Also, there is a nicely sized shopping centre. Between Bayswater and Queensway stations is a bowling and ice skating centre!

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable”
Reviews.Author: aaawilson08
Reviews.Content: Great Location no frills but clean enough and affordable. Nothing to get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TakeOff_N
Reviews.Content: It is a basic hotel next to Bayswater underground station, in a very plesant area. Single rooms were provided at competitive price. The room was clean and comfortable even though it was very small. It also included all basic amenities. The facilities were in good condition, too.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: MSS79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night whilst attending a gig at Wembley Stadium. The hotel is in a lovely area and was a 2 minute walk from Bayswater tube station. Check in was fine and speedy, the staff were extremely friendly and attentive. We were in room 24, I had taken note of previous reviews on Tripadvisor so was adamant I was not going to be staying in a basement room. The room was small with a double bed against the window/wall, 1 bedside table with a light (which did not work), 1 wardrobe, a dressing table and ensuite bathroom. It all just looked a bit tired and in need of a makeover, the pillow cases, bed sheets and towels were clean though. I think we were in the room a total of 8 hours which included sleeping and showering which for what we paid I did not expect much more for the money. Breakfast was included but we decided not to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: theirishleprechaun
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel in a great area in London. The price is very competitive and pound for pound, it is one of the best hotels in London. Staff are amazingly friendly. I have stayed in a lot of hotels across the world and the staff here are some of the best. The rooms and the hotel in general are very clean. It is really close to Bayswater underground station and is situated in a lovely,safe neighbourhood. You can also leave you bags for free on the day you check out if you have a late flight, so that is an added bonus. The only negative is the size of the rooms- they are fairly small and compact. However, they are adequate and it should not put you off. Overall, a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: World_travellor79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. The location was great. The staff was super friendly. When they found out it was our honeymoon, they up-graded our room and included breakfast for all of the time we stayed here. We really enjoyed it. The rooms were a bit smaller than we were used too...but otherwise, the place was clean and comfy. I would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: BizzolJess
Reviews.Content: The cleaners obviously smoke in the rooms as they clean as on return to the hotel after both days out the room smell strongly of smoke. The shower was broken, the reception staff less than friendly and the room was tiny. Reem hotel does have a great location but I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steffie100
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at bookings.com for a set amount of money. When i arrived at the hotel, i was told that the price that i was quoted and prepaid for was the wrong price and that it was going to cost me much more to stay there. The receptionist told me that i could cancel the reservations with no penalityy. However i arrived in the evening and the taught of going out and trying to find another hotel in a city that i was not familiar with did not apeal to me. So i ended up having to stay there for almost double the price that i was quoted. The hotel it self was average. The room was very small and the bathroom clogged up when i took a shower. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: nusit
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 days. My room was a bit small, but clean and renovated with teamaking facilities, safe, hairdryer and a big window on the garden. The bathroom was small but clean and comfortable. The staff is kind. An internet position is available in the lobby. Continental breakfast was included in the price. Very good and with a large choice of food. With few pounds it's possible to "upgrade" it to English breakfast. The position is strategic, close to Circle and Central Line, in the nice area of Bayswater.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: mssunshine47
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and I am really loving this hotel. The location is perfect! By tube you can reach the city center in 10 minutes. Furthermore Bayswater it self is very nice and close to notting hill which is a very nice place to spend some time. The ambience is very good, it is a small hotel, with small rooms. But the rooms are clean and the bathroom is in good state. The staff of the hotel is very nice and friendly. For this prive i can defenitely say it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Reem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daines27
Reviews.Content: I've been looking through the reviews here and there are many negative accounts recently. The place is very cheap, and in a great location. Like many before me have said, if you want a base in London and you want to save money for your sightseeing etc., then the Reem Hotel is certainly great to use. I found the hotel clean, albeit small, and my partner and I had a pleasant (quiet!) stay. I must say, I really enjoyed the foreign television channels we could pick up from our room. The decor was a bit dated, but that really isn't a problem! For just Â£40 a pop, there's no room left to be pedantic in my opinion. Let's face it, London does need hotels like this (cheap, great location). I must admit, we had no problems regarding toilets, cracked tiles, etc., or mice even! So we never had to converse with the staff really, but they seemed nice and friendly on our arrival. Oh! No, we did run out of tea, because we like tea, but there was a very prompt knock on the door and all was solved.

Reviews.Title: “still catching up on sleep”
Reviews.Author: Pewsey
Reviews.Content: After toying with a short half-term break to Cornwall we settled on spending three days in London doing the tourist thing. We had lived n London previously for fifteen years but had never done the sights and wanted our daughter to experience the sights and sounds of London. I looked at some gorgeous hotels but they were all out of our price bracket and found some budget/moderate hotels one of which was The Reem Hotel which is in a fantastic location between Bayswater,Portebello and Notting Hill. That I'm afraid is the only plus. We had a triple room which was the tiniest room ever in which single bed and a 4ft bed (not a standard double) was squashed! I had to move the wardrobe, side table and beds in order to open the bathroom door(which was very clean but the toilet didn't flush without slushing a few glasses of water). We had some fab days in London and fitted so much in but at night my husband and I got absolutely nil hours sleep, the mattress was so uncomfortable the springs dug into us which ever way we turned. I had bruises and aches for days after and was very grouchy. My daughter actually caught her leg on a spring sticking out the side of our bed and I regret not photographing it. I will never go budget again and have well and truly learnt our lesson next time it's blow the budget!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - a health hazard”
Reviews.Author: langtoonlad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a health hazard. The room we had was very poorly maintained and the main problem was the shower. The tiles in the shower were cracked and had obviously been this way for some months judging by the amount of mould ousing from the cracks. We asked for this to be cleaned up but it did not happen. This hotel should be closed down on health grounds.

Reviews.Title: “I had a mouse in my room!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl604
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is difficult to find. The address is "Princes Square" but it isn't on the square, but behind it, so it took forever to find the place. The main issue was the mouse that ran under the door at me in the morning after I had slept there! I screamed and the mouse hid. Need I say more? I couldn't stand to be there any longer and we left the hotel. The staff acted surprised and were apologetic and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a budget”
Reviews.Author: nikki27
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Reem hotel for just one night. The hotel itself is extremely hard to find. The streets make no sense at all. The room we were allocated was on the reception floor of the hotel. very small but clean and cosy for just one night. the bathroom could have done with a refurb but everything worked well inside. We paid just Â£39 for the room, which included breakfast for both of us. which we thought was a great price. where else in London would you have got that????? For anyone who just wants a base to sleep in, in London, with no frills this is ideal. would return. i've spent a lot more money in London on a lot worse hotels!

Reviews.Title: “i'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: primavera44
Reviews.Content: I wasnt expecting much but was pleasantly surprised! Excellent location! right near the underground station and shops. I stayed here 4 nights in a single room. It was hard to find at first, but the worker at the front desk went out and greeted me when I called. I just needed a low-budget hotel to sleep and shower in so i was very pleased. i stayed alone and felt very safe, being a female travel. the shower was very nice, plumbing and drains worked very well, the room was clean, temperature was just right, the room was small, but cozy. there was wi fi access downstairs and coffee/tea facilities in room (which i didnt use), a hairdryer was provided, a couple electrical socks, and a tv. I have no complaints! great stay!

Reviews.Title: “in urgent need of renovation!”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: positive: good location, low rates, helpful staff, clean sheets and towels,tv with English/German/American tv channels available, electrical kettle in the room for preparing tea/coffee, bathroom equipment functioned properly. room small though large enough for manoeuvreing without problems (didnÂ´t need to walk sideways between the furniture, unproblematic access to sink, toilet and shower cubicle, doors could be opened and closed normally). negative: old disgusting carpet with black stains, awful mattress (felt each spring and did not sleep well), mould in the shower cubicle, musty smell in the room. would only return to this hotel after complete renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Reem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeedsNorthEngland
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Reem Hotel was quite small and in need of a coat of paint and new carpet. The room was also very warm, but it did come with an electric fan, which we never turned off. But it was a very quiet room; I took the advice of a previous reviewer who said to book a room overlooking the garden at the back. The shower was very good, with plenty of hot water. But the best thing about this hotel is the location: it's just around the corner from the tube station (takes just a few minutes to the tourist sites)- Bayswater itself is such an interesting and peaceful location - and a short walk to Notting Hill and Kensington Palace. I paid Â£59 a night for a double room, which I found very good value for money. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good price/quality balance”
Reviews.Author: markEurope
Reviews.Content: the REEM hotel has a good price/quality balance. +: The comfortable location, clean rooms, private bathroom, the included breakfast, friendly staff -: rooms are small, rooms get fairly warm due to the small size

Reviews.Title: “Low cost accommodation in Central London”
Reviews.Author: Alx-UK
Reviews.Content: I spend one night at the Reem Hotel in Bayswater after a Christmas Party this week getting a double room with breakfast for Â£35. With expectations of 2 star hotel for Â£35 set appropriately low I was expecting bad and got average. It is about 10 minutes walk from Queensway station on the central line and about 5 minutes from Bayswater high street so location wise not too bad and set in a residential area. Reception very friendly and efficient, the TV remote in my room was missing so they gave me the reception remote, check out was fast with no surprises. The room was small but had tea and coffee making facilities, tv, storage, en suite etc, I had a double room in the basement and it was small and basic but I have paid over Â£100 in 4 star hotels and found myself in smaller single rooms with nicer curtains so it's a choice and if you are only looking for a place to stay for a night rather than the base for a holiday I would recommend this hotel if you get the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: snuffers
Reviews.Content: Room was VERY small (paid around $93CDN via expedia). No breakfast provided without a fee. They had a kettle in the room, to make instant noodles, soups, coffee. This hotel is in a good location for the price, only a few blocks away from the Baywater Tube station and Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “will do in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: Springers
Reviews.Content: Okay, if you arrive in London sans hotel and this is the only place with rooms available then it's not the end of the world. Assets are the friendly staff, location, hot water, clean bedding and breakfast room/food. Liabilities are noisy street, smoke smelling, tiny rooms, no air conditioning, dirty, thread bare carpet, lumpy mattresses and moldy showers. My room was large enough for one twin bed and not even another twin bed could have been placed in the room for additional sleeping. There is barely enough room to walk between the bed and the wall, so if you're overweight, FORGET IT. It's not a three star hotel, but it's probably a high two star. For 2 extra euros, you can upgrade from the continental breakfast to a full blown cooked meal with sausage and eggs. Really, if someone were to re-carpet, paint, add a/c and new mattresses, this place would be the cats meow. The location is terrific, only about 1/2 mile from the Bayswater Metro Station and very convenient to banks, restaurants and terrific shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: oldkiwi
Reviews.Content: After 18 hours in the air and at airports, we were looking forward to a shower and a rest before hitting the traps. The entrance to the Reem gave an early indication of what lay ahead - is it the narrowest hotel entrance in the world? Inside, it got worse. Up we went to the top floor in a lift the size of a suitcase, and along a creepy narrow corridor that screamed "fire risk". I couldn't quite believe it when I opened the door to the room: it was quite impossibly small - so small that I measured it - 14 square metres! The bathrfoom (if you cld call it that) was three times the size of a 747 toilet space! It was as hot as hell up on that top floor, and the sense of claustrophobia was latent. We suffered the first night, and demanded a lower, more spacious room thereafter. It wasn't full, so we got a room with three single beds, and a decent-sized bathroom on the ground floor. It was pretty shabby and gloomy, but at least we didn't have that crammed in feeling. It's all very well to say "that's London" - but I don't think that's good enough. This room cost us 60 pound a night for a week, and someone is creaming it at the expense of visitors. A three-star hotel? You gotta be joking!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area, adequate digs.”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lovely section of London and walking in the area is a pleasure. We also found a number of excellent restaurants in the area. The hotel was convenient to the Bayswater Tube stop and was perfectly adequate for our needs. The room was small and spare but we did not travel to stay in a hotel. It was neither the best nor worst but I would certainly go back for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Reem Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 50-51 Prince's Square | Bayswater, London W2 4PX, England
